info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 10 at 9:22AM EDT until August 10 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Wilmington NC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northeast South Carolina, including the following county, Georgetown.
* WHEN...Until 1115 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways, particularly in the beach communities.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 921 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Georgetown, DeBordieu Colony, Pawleys Island, Oatland, Graves, Litchfield Beach and Georgetown Memorial Hospital. - weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM EDT THIS MORNING
